definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: You can tell he is a parvenu.
sentences.chinese: 你看他財大氣粗，就知道他是個暴發戶。

sentences.english: I find myself feeling like either a deep-pocketed patsy or a skinflint.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得自己好像是一個財大氣粗的帕齊或者是吝嗇鬼。

sentences.english: The sums involved were small beer for a behemoth like GE.
sentences.chinese: 涉及金額對財大氣粗的通用來說不過是九牛一毛。

sentences.english: As we all know, the tobacco industry is ruthless, devious, rich, and powerful.
sentences.chinese: 衆所周知，菸草業財大氣粗，狡猾無情。

definition: to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
to push oneself forward/to seek fame/to be in the limelight/same as 出鋒頭|出锋头[chu1 feng1 tou5]
